30954908.review:
Este jogo tem a premissa de trazer de volta os antigos Battle Races dos 90's

Um Battle Race é um jogo onde, alem de exercitar sua habilidade de Motorista, irá exigir um pouco da sua sorte como competidor XD o jogo te dá armas aleátorias, e com elas você pode Atacar, se Defender, e se Recuperar.

Eu joguei 'Sonic & Sega: All-Stars Racing', 'F1 Stars', 'Mario Kart', 'Crash Racing', e muitos outros Battle Races do gênero, e no geral, todos tendem a ser jogos de gráfico bem "animado", tudo bem puxado pro estilo gráfico da Nintendo. Isto não significa que são ruins, só que você meio que entra no jogo já "Sabendo" o que vai ver, entende? Meio que estraga o Game, se torna algo repetitivo. E as trilhas sonoras são bem alegrinhas, eu me sinto com 10 anos denovo, é super divertido, recomendo ein?!

Mas falando de GRIP agora, e o que o jogo traz de novo e diferente:

O gráfico feito na Unreal Engine 4, traz consigo uma grande variedade de detalhes, de efeitos, e de opções para que os criadores do jogo possam brincar bastante com diferentes Power-Ups, Mapas e Customizações de veículo.

Os carros em si tem um Design bem legal, nada muito diferente no entanto... Você pode customizar a Cor em diferentes areas deles, alguns podendo alterar a calota, e todos eles o pneu. O Bacana é que cada carro tem Detalhes Técnicos únicos, e ai cada pessoa desenvolve sua habilidade em um, seguindo sua lógica na corrida XD

Já os mapas tem um cenário bem desenhado, porem é sempre ou tudo muito "Metálico", ou muito "Cheio de pedra", ai fode né? queremos variedade, Devs!
Mesmo assim, são mapas incriveis, de todos eles eu recomendo o Bowl pra poder zuar ;p

Os Power-Ups são bem bacanas de usar, você pode juntar 2 deles e usar na hora que quiser, nada muito diferente...

cara, sendo sincero o jogo está bem "Completo", nada vai fazer você pensar que ele esta em acesso antecipado, de verdade isso. Mas falta algumas coisas no jogo mesmo assim... Sinto falta de controlar o carro no ar quando saio voando da pista, as vezes ele cai todo torto e tu se fode inteiro :c gostaria tambem de um editor de niveis, ou até mesmo (assim como em outros jogos) que a comunidade pudesse criar os novos carros, power-ups, mapas, etc. Ia ser muito bacana! Sinto falta de algo visualmente mais atrativo no HUD, e o "radar/mapa" é um pouco confuso, seria mais legal se fosse similar ao do "The:Crew", as vezes eu percebo que tem um caminho paralelo só depois de 5 voltas, se eu tivesse um mapa mais detalhado saberia exatamente por onde ir, e onde localizar meus inimigos no mapa, então arrumem isso!

Pra finalizar, vamo falar da sua expêriencia como jogador, como ela será?
Ah, ai tu vai ter que comprar pra sentir! Porque é indescritivel a sensação de dar 50 mortal e cair certinho na pista, desviar de obstaculos lá nos 600 km/h, e é muito foda ver um monte de explosão e tu passar por tudo ileso! É Incrivel!

Eu recomendo muito, mas véi, aproveita a recente atualização do Multiplayer e compra com os amigos, ein!

30952967.review:
Not a bad reboot of Rollcage, but this release still needs work. I'm writing this review on the first day that multiplayer came out. So far, it is a lot like the original; fast, hectic, cool music, cool "cars, etc. What really bothers me is how unforgiving this game is. I'll go into pros and cons.

Pros:
+ beautiful graphics
+ fast and exciting gameplay
+ great art design, both with the cars and tracks
+ classic Rollcage feeling
+ soundtrack is perfect

Cons:
- you will reset your car contantly from flying everywhere, reset is a necessary game mechanic
- cars are flat out difficult to control... wall riding is common, despite brakes and "drift" (I see this with other players all the time too - refer to above con)
- the camera is wonky; rather than staying behind your car, on tight turns and crashes the camera will do whatever
- in multiplayer, collisions with other players are way off: you are likely to ricochet into the walls from hitting other players while they ride off unscathed
- heavier cars are just better

This game is fun and addicting, but it would be a little better if the cars were just easier to control themselves so they work better with the hectic combat, high speeds and hazard-littered racetracks. I'll still recommend, for nostalgia and early access.

Ce jeu à de bonnes bases , mais je ne peux pas recommander à qui que ce soit de l'achetter en l'état . 

Pour : 

- Graphismes sympas 
- Principe de rollcage ( haut / bas ) 
- impression de vitesse 
- items ( même si très peux ) 
- écran splitté en local ( toujours apréciable )
- modes de jeux ( peux nombreux mais efficaces ) 

Contre : 

- Maniabilité ( gros point noir pour moi , freinages peu précis , frein à main quasi inutile ) et précision dans la direction
- Physique des véhicules ( de gros engins qui flottent comme des plumes lancées a mach 12 ) 
- Le mode multi qui à été lancé bien trop tard ( personne sur les serveurs pour l'instant ) 
- Manque de passages techniques et d'ambition dans les cicuits proposés ( surrement du à la maniabilité )

Je conseille donc d'attendre une sortie définitive pour voir si la maniabilité et la physique on été revues et si le multi est viable , en espérant que les devs continuent leurs efforts car le jeu a vraiment du potentiel , je croise les doigts

30952263.review:
Yep, initial impression is that this is pretty fricking cool. Very high quality for an early access title.

Pros:
- Multiplayer worked really well, considering  they just put it out at the time of me writing this. Easy and reliable to match up with friends.
- Well optimized. FX8350/970 - everything on ultra and silky smooth.
- Beatiful looking.
- While strange at first, the handling of the cars is pretty decent and doesn't take long to get used to.
- The banging dnb soundtrack.
- Track design.
- Good selection of game modes.
- Devs seem very devoted to this project.
- Bots are smart enough to enjoy single player thourougly.

Cons:
- Some cars seem OP.
- Crashes can be a little too unforgiving.
- No controller support in menus as of yet.

----Original Review at Bottom---

Alright so it seems my review oddly got a small amount of attention. I'm not really a super awesome curator review person, but, since it's had some attention I'll update it to be a bit more proper using Pro's and Con's

Pro's:
Visuals are fantastic
IMO the game feels kind of immersive due to way the screen has a visual effect at higher speeds

Combat is well done without being overpowering, and if thats not your sort of thing you can disable pickups and use classic race mode where position determins a win.

The maps are varried accross different planets, each with a different enviroment.

The multiplayer is good and works. I don't have a lot of play time, but, I played several matches in arena and racing, and I didn't encounter any issues. Abliet the voting system did just recieve a patch.

Cons:
Some of the maps can be quite difficult but are still a WIP. I played the WIP Sky track map today and found it somewhat difficult to get back in 1st after getting hit by a rocket on an upside down portion of the track which leads me to my next con

The Reset mechanic. It can be a bit squarilly at times, and is best invoked yourself rather than letting it do it itself. And even then, when you are reset on an upside down portion of the track, it can be very hard to get enough speed back up to not fall again to get reset again. Try and aim for a green turbo arrow on the track right away when your reset if in this situation, if there are any.


------
So, thats a bit of an update to the review, yes I know it's not the best review, but, I have a huge backlog of games and ADHD so it's a bit hard at times for me to keep track of it all. If this review keeps getting attention, I'll try to update it as I play more. 



TLDR; It's a great remake of an older game with a pretty unique style of racing. I'd buy again.

30829716.review:
In the modern world of gaming, a lot of venerated video game genres have died a slow death - most notably the 90s platformer.

Another genre that suffered the same fate was the combat racer.

And just like the 90s platformer, the combat racer has risen from the grave with GRIP.

I did not grow up in the heyday of these games - I was four years old when Rollcage was released, and the most combat-est of a racing game I played was the PS2's Rumble Racing (which was amazing).

For the longest time, I have been searching for a racing game that was not an uber-realism Gran Turismo wannabe, and here it is. It saddens me when I ask someone if they enjoy racing games, and they say 'no, I don't like Forza or Project CARS'. There is so much more to the genre than having the highest polycount vehicle model.

This is a racing game for people who don't usually play racing games. It's easy to learn but difficult to master. You can play it for 10 minutes, or 100. It's versatile, loud, engaging, and strikes the perfect balance of inducing righteous fury at the guy who hit you with a missile while not making you so angry you quit the game.

Most importantly - it's fun to lose.

For myself, who grew up with Rumble Racing, Motorstorm, Test Drive: Eve of Destruction, and Jak X, I can immediately see that the developers care about what they are doing. The music is amazing, the environments are stunning, the motion blur is excellent, the particle effects are the right mix of sensibility and EXPLOSION. Each sound and visual is tailored so that you know exactly what is happening on screen. As your vehicle gets more damaged, your HUD begins to lose integrity in a fantastically thematic way. The vehicles feel meaty and weighty, and you rarely feel like a crash was the fault of the physics engine.

EDIT: Okay, not rarely. Usually. The physics engine is the devs' current main focus, and while it's come a long way, your car will still do some wacky things on occasion.

It is in early access, so there are bugs. There is an excellent forum for reporting, and bugs are constantly being fixed by the dev team.

We need to prove to the world that games that aren't MOBAs, arena shooters, or freemium microtransaction stores can SUCCEED. Buy this game, and invest in both the future of the game industry and the future of your procrastination time simultaneously.

30794899.review:
Tout d'abord, mon avis intéressera seulement les connaisseurs de Rollcage.
Je suis un gros gros fan de pas mal d'opus fait par amour par psygnosis a l'époque.
parmi eux, mon préféré, celui auquel j'ai passé toute mon enfance et dès mes 10 ans, Rollcage Stage II. j'en ai passé des journées entières a poncer RS2, quel bonheur...

ce matin, tête dans le cul, je découvre absolument par hasard ce jeu Grip... première critique de ma part: roh la mauvaise copie ! (parce-que je n'aime pas les plagiats non assumé) mais quand j'ai vu la description stipulant que grip est inspiré de rollcage, jme suis dis "FEU".

Et franchement... c'est un phoquing bon début!! et même si pour moi (avis purement subjectif) rollcage restera a jamais inégalé, Grip me satisfait déja bien assez!
prenez Rollcage mais façon moderne, genre la légitime suite que j'attend depuis 17 ans.
pour dire a quel point j'ai été ému en jouant a grip, j'ai ajouté a la playlist du jeu les musiques de rollcage stage 2 et en jouant, j'en ai pleuré de joie (pour de vrais).

je ne l'ai pas encore testé a 100% mais Grip est fait avec art et amour, c'est rapide, fluide, énergique, violent, pointu, beau, c'est puissant quoi.
un petit Bémol, il ne tourne pas en 60 fps chez moi: graphisme au minium ou au max, il tombe quand même entre 60 et 40 fps... dommage, peut être ce problème seras corrigé plus tard (je l’espère)

je ne préfère pas dévoiler le jeu, je vous laisse seul juge mais il vous avez aimez Rollcage, n'hésitez par pour Grip.

Pour finir, j'espère vraiment que ce jeux sera fini proprement car c'est vraiment un bon début et je ne sais pas si c'est légal, mais si les dévs peuvent ajouter les circuits de RS2, même en dlc je les achèterais sans sourciller. 

Je souhaite une très bonne continuation au devs, en attendant, je jubile.

Par ou commencer ??

J'ai connu Rollcage étant petit et j'ai eu la chance de faire quelques parties avec mon père sur notre premier PC familial (AOL et joystick ! Le bon temps je te jure !!)....

Et voila que je découvre GRIP le digne fils de Rollcage sur Steam 15 ans plus tard et mon dieu quel jeu !

Il est tout simplement génial, les graphismes sont époustouflant et l'impression de vitesse est incroyable !

Ca fait du bien un bon jeu bien arcade et futuriste comme il faut dans le quel on peut se foutre sur la gueule avec des bagnoles d'enfer qui passe le 600 km/h et avec des armes de taré ! Franchement après une journée de merde c'est LE jeu auquel il faut jouer !

Biensur il est en early access et on aimerais tous quelques caisses en plus et des circuits encore plus baré façon Hot Wheels (encore un clin d'oeil a mon enfance!) mais chapeau aux dev. car il font un super boulot !

A toutes les presonnes qui comme moi ne pourons pas mettre la main sur WipEout Omega Collection (j'ai choisi la Xbox ONE hélas) ou qui ne supportent pas l'attente, foncez tête baisser sur GRIP !!

Embarquez dans vos machines, attachez vos harnais et préparez vous à prendre une claque au démarage et à avoir la tête en bas ! Cardiaques et ames sensibles s'abstenir car Rollcage est de retour plus rapide et déroutant que jamais !

Amis pilotes, rendez vous sur les pistes de GRIP !!

30223405.review: good potential in this game. needs a lot of work though before I can see myself giving a flawless review like I want to do. the game is fun but there are quite a few glaring issues I have with it. the cars needs better tranction as they feel like they're jsut floating on the ground or wall you're drivign on and love to spin out if you so much as bump into a pebble. and if you bump into another car both cars will spin out, it takes away fromt he flow of the race as you'll have massive pile ups of cars a lot of times. secondly the missles tend to explode as soon as deployed hurting you more often than your target. map design is good enough but the physics need to be much smoother to fit some of them as they clearly had obsicles and sharp turns in mind to make it more challanging but without smooth turning and your car jumping all over the place it really isn't an enjoyable experience to try to play said maps. thirdly, in some maps if you get flung off the side of the map from the controls being not all the responsive or hitting something on the track you can run on the side of invisible walls set throughout the course. this leads to some very hilarious moments where you'll be driving your car sideways in the sky. I would reccomend putting some taller walls on some levels so if you spin out or get flung you don't immediately get outside the intended play area of the track. thankfully there is a reset button which helps in situations like that but it's uncanny how many times I found myself having to use it because of things liek that. these are the biggest issues I have with the game but overall I see a lot of promise in this game and I hope as it develops we'll see some of these issues fixed. also just a suggestion to the developer, maybe add a turbo boost meter that fills up with boost pickups? I know you have turbo as a power up but I feel a bar that everyone can fill up and store for later use and use it up only as long as you have the turbo button held meaning you could just give yourself a nudge to get going again and still have plenty left over would be a very welcome addition to the game. getting up to speed after a crash is much to slow given how often you'll end up crashing from the controls and bouncy nature of the physics as it is right now. being able to get back up to speed faster after a halt would help keep the pace of the race going for the player. anyways I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a combat racing game for the price and I wish the best to the developer in making this game the best it can be.

29918890.review:
**UPDATED FIRST IMPRESSIONS:**
Fist let me make this clear that I writing this review based on a limited test play.  Also that my views are based on that fact that I wanted this game to be NEXT RollCage.  

It had such a great start a year ago when I first looked  at it.   The vehicle and driving characteristics was spot on.  The fun and the edge of the seat racing was what it was all about.  Check out my first impressions back then:

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lM-xEtZsmR0

Then a year later I was told that this has been updated, more cars, more tracks and a huge overhaul.  I fired the puppy up and this is what I got after these major updates:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YlAOTbX3PIg

From my first impressions this has now been turned into a Mario Kart style racing game?  Gone are the edge of the seat driving physics and in most cases the fun.  

Its a £11.99 game and its been in early dev for a year.  Nothing bad about that.  But only a couple of new tracks, no default online multiplayer, still no menu pad controls.  

Again, its early access and I understand that.  But for the price this is being sold I got to judge it on what else I can get in that price range.   Looking back at some of the games released a year ago, many AAAs, some awesome Indies and at the moment this is falling well short.  Not to mention some of the great titles released cheaper and in some cases FREE?

It has the promise to be so much.  To take the mantle of the best racer in this genre.  But in this latest update the handling has been nerfed, none of the promises of the Multiplayer have come, basic menu controls missing.  Its transformed everything that made Rollcage a hit and replaced it with Mario Kart.

Its not a bad game, its just not the game it wanted to be right now.  But for the price and what has been done int he space of a year I cannot recommend this game :(  I hope that things do change and I can do another one of these videos.  But for now it looks like this is going to be deleted from my HDD for another year until the next "update"

*JUDGED FROM THE 15 MINUTES I GAVE IT, ITS NOT A REVIEW ITS MY FIRST IMPRESSIONS*

Things I like about GRIP: 
[list]
    [*]The overwhelming sense of speed and (very often) uncontollable thrust. 
    [*]The huge weight of the vehicles that you can feel while driving (not so much after patch 1.2.7). 
    [*]The awesome graphics (for a bit of an old-timey Rollcage feel: all settings on Epic, except for Film Grain: 0%, Motion Blur and Sharpening: off, Post Process: low). 
    [*]The powerful sound FX of the combined internal combustion and jet (rocket?) engines. 
    [*]The atmospheric racing circuits on several different planets. 
    [*]The absurd amount of practice and luck necessary to win on highest difficulty in single player (just like it was in the Rollcage games). 
    [*]The community-oriented developers with their regular updates to the game. 
[/list]
Things I do not like about GRIP (even considering it is still in Early Access):
[list] 
    [*] The game isn't finished yet, dammit! I want more content.

Voici une surprise et elle est de taille, 

GRIP,  est LE Rollcage de l'époque remasterisé 2016. Perso j'attendais un jeu comme celui la qui a bercer mon avance de gamer.  
DIgne successeur spirituel on y retrouve les circuits bien tordus, les bolides qui ont plus du tank que de la voiture de course, la sensation de vitesse et biensur l'armement :).

Ca va vite très très vite, on roule partout sur le sol les murs le plafond, et quoi de mieux pour le style que de faire une figure accrobatique avant d'envoyer votre petit missile sur la tronche de vos adversaires (humiliation? domination?) :)

La bande son est plus que convainquante, musique sur fond électro (voir indus :)) se préte parfaitement au titre et viens renforcer la sensation de vitesse, le son des mitailleuses est enivrant, on sent toute la puissance de l'arme, et les missiles sont tout simplement juisifs ;) (on entend le moteur se mettre en route et le missile atteindre sa vitesse de croisière juste avant le grand BOOM ;) ).

Graphiquement magnifique, riche en couleur et effets, le titre est un vrai plaisir pour les yeux également, Les explosions sont superbes et heureusement que sur les circuits et les arène ont la dose de missile car on en redemande tant c'est festif par ces magnifiques explosions.

Le gameplay est simple mais efficace, le principe tout aussi simple. Atteindre la ligne d'arriver en restant en vie et en pole possition si possible ;). Mais finir une courses en difficulté élévé est pas chose si simple à faire. Vous devrez être sans pitié et maitrisser votre bolide a plus de 500km/h (bon courage !!! :) ).

Actuellement en Early Access, le jeu est encore à ses débuts et déjà il est à la hauteur  de nos espérances. Je crois aux développeur et je leur fait confiance pour l'avenir, espérons qu'ils rajoutent du contenus et pourquoi pas de nouvelles armes et bonus (tels que des canon gauss, des lasers, des repairs, ...), et toujours plus de circuits et toujours plus de fun.

Vous l'aurez compris, ce jeu est une BOMBE et on prend litéralement plein la gueule (désolé de la tournure mais la faut le dire sérieux). 

MERCI, MERCI, MERCI, MERCI  aux développeurs ;) 

ENJOY ;)

29755827.review:
Remember Rollcage?
This game is the successor to Rollcage, and was even made with the help of some of the original Rollcage devs.
For those who never played Rollcage:
GRIP is a fun arcade racer where your goal to simply go fast and win 1st place in a car similiar to those badass RC cars which could drive upside down and wish you had as a kid. In order to avoid momentum loss you can use the track itself to ROLL around (on tunnels, walls, in the air, and on map specefic contraptions), while managing to keep your tires on the ground (upside-down or vice-versa). Such a simple gimmic creats plenty of fun moments and creates a surprising difficulty curve for   those who love arcade racing.

I'll update this Review if I change my mind, but the first impression was devastating. You rarely have to take your finger off the acceleration button, only small direction-corrections are enough to stay on the track. Brakes, you don't need them, it seems. It's pretty much all about fighting your contrahents (with about 2 weapons and 2? kinds of mines and a shield). 

I can't believe how this game scored so well in the community. It's one of the most boring racers I've played. Looking back to the F-Zero games this can't compete at all imho. Sorry.

Edit: from the comments the developer stated: 
"It's true, the game goes fast and you can hold the accelerator most of the time. Right now it's more about precision movements and holding the best racing line, narrowly missing objects on the track while avoiding fire from opponents."

It's a pretty accurate description, I agree with everything. The things I miss in this game are: 
-) having more challenging courses so that you have to brake/decelerate more often
-) having a higher penalty for leaving the racing line

I guess it's best to try it first, Steam offers a refund-option if you aren't sure if it's the game for you. I took that option, maybe others won't.

¡De los desarrolladores de Rollcage y Rollcage Stage II llega GRIP!

Este pequeño analisis esta orientado a jugadores que ya conoscan el mecanismo del juego inspirado en los juegos Rollcage, asi que solo hare unas comparaciones y datos tecnicos.

Mi PC: Windows 10 Pro 64bits
           AMD FX-4300
           8GB de RAM (1333mhz)
           R7 250 1GB GDDR5

> El juego lo corro a 1360x768
> Todas las opciones graficas en Bajo, excepto Texturas en Medio; Efectos Especiales en Épico (Ultra), Post-Proccesing en Medio.
> 30fps en la largada
> 40 a 45fps durante el resto de la carrera
> Hay muchas opciones graficas para que el juego sea jugable aunque tengas una pc peor que la mia lol.
> El mapeo de los controles puede llegar bugearse y no guardarse correctamente.

> Aunque el juego sea inspirado en los Rollcage, no son lo mismo. Se siente muy diferente en como se comportan los coches, por ejemplo, habra veces en que deberas frenar o derrapar para tomar una curva porque ahora los coches si se sienten que son moles de 10 toneladas a diferencia de los autitos del Rollcage.

> Las armas disponibles por ahora son: Misil Rastreador, Misil Lider, Pulso Electromagnetico, Mina, Ametralladora, Escudo e Hypervelocidad.

> Se puede jugar en pantalla divida para dos jugadores, y hay planes para implementar el multijugador online.

Todavia queda mucho para que este juego se sienta completo porque queda muchas cosas que pulir. Quizas lo mas atrapante del juego sean sus renovados graficos, pero si mi reseña no te convece no lo compres a menos que quieras ayudar a los desarroladores. Ciertamente estan comprometidos con este juego y lo han ido actualizando muy a menudo, y estoy mas que seguro que no lo dejaran morir porque ellos tambien son fanaticos de la saga Rollcage :D

29598950.review:
Ok. Remember playing hot wheels when you were young? 
Shooting up your brothers and sisters' vehicles and learnig how to be a general douch, While occasionally pulling off stunts.  This game is Very nice and you would definitely get the same feeling from here. It's fast and the mech-like vehicles gives you a weird sense of badassery without doing really anything.

The only real Items I have to pick with this is: Lack of barriers, bounce physics and machine gun.
Barriers because it is amazing to get on a mountain and be able to just flip or flop off of and back to stage.(Made me think of Mass Effect), BUT! flying off  into them amidst heat is really annoying. One major flop and that race is done. 
(Speaking of when online was to hit).

Bounce Physics. In some parts of the maps there are spots In the middle of the road where you can just flip out. 
Sky Track Has landing points where you will pop off of the road, and if you have played the track for a long while you notice, falling off is the easiest thing to do there.  Missile? Off you go. Machine gun> Goodbye. Random wreck because all other racers spun out due to bounce? You know the drill. Just tone down the bouncing on the road. 

Machine Gun. This seems to be overpowered. I know this isnt finished but just so you know. Machine Gun makes the vehicles hit bounce and swerve (of course) as long as you keep hitting them. It takes down the opponents full shield and can still kill that opponent IF you tardet only him. All in one. Maybe im wrong ther, but i'm positive I've destroyed may cars by just slowing down and letting it go.  

Oh, You can glitch through Sky Track. Besides these, This is just an awesome game.

Lastly, I thought having to hand break just to make a small turn sometimes was a pain, but the vehicles are massive and it began to feel good.

Edit: Last Last thing... Hitting barrels that are strewn about and flying because of it. Make them pause you, Not send you packing.

29566031.review:
Grip : Quand le « Rollcage de 1999 » renait de ses cendres en 2016. Un Early Access à suivre de prêt.

Test complet détaillé sur : http://lesgrosjeuxdupc.fr/grip/
Pour Le test vidéo c'est ici :
https://youtu.be/bhkEbSkbtfA

Résumé :

++ Une équipe de développement sérieuse qui s’investi dans son projet (pas toujours le cas en Early Access)
++ Techniquement bien avancé
++ Une direction artistique soignée
++ L’univers industriel mécanique
++ La sensation de vitesse bien rendue
++ Animation et fluidité sans faille
++ Un Arsenal suffisant pour atomiser la gueule de son prochain comme il faut (et l’humilier parce qu’il le mérite)
++ Les modes de « courses simples » variées (classique, élimination, course ultime, arène…)
+   La bande son électro-boum-boum (jungle) qui colle bien à l’atmosphère du jeu.
+   Avoir sa caisse qui roule la tête en bas et qui croche dans les virages incurvés
+   Une Intelligence Artificiel qui fait l’affaire dans la plupart des cas
+   Le multijoueur en local
+   Les différentes caméras qui fonctionnent bien
+   Tuner sa « tarantule mécanique » en la peignant en fuchsia et jaune fluo

-   Peu de choix dans les véhicules (4 ou 5)
-   Quelques problèmes de collision à améliorer
-   Voitures qui valsent facilement dans le décor sur certaines portions de circuit un peu bosselée
-   Certains circuits ou obstacles inadaptés au gabarit des véhicules (où est ce que je passe avec mes jantes en 64 pouces ?)
--  Contenu encore maigre malgré les 2 circuits ajoutés il y a peu de temps (7 circuits et 2 arènes)
--  Prix un peu élevé pour un Early Access
--  Pas (encore) de Multijoueur en ligne

La technique est irréprochable, ce qui est mis à disposition des joueurs fonctionnent parfaitement et l'équipe de Cage Element semble résoudre progressivement les quelques soucis de collisions. Pour les amateurs ou les nostalgiques de courses futuristes, Grip possède du potentiel. Seul le prix un peu élevé pour le contenu proposé freinera  les curieux. Grip est à suivre du coin de l’œil dans le rétro. Wait and see…

29511116.review:
for a game that was released on my birthday, and considering it's essentially a reboot of one of my childhood game's, i'm a little annoyed that i've only just found out about Grip nearly a year after it's release...maybe now i can throw away my original [url=https://gyazo.com/cf046db48b3249e3611d90cba7676e1b]copy of Rollcage?[/url] pffft nah never. This is even being made by some of the dudes who did the original. nice

Anyway, IMO:

-Grip looks great visually and retains the style of it's inspired original very well, not just in the levels but the cars too. 

-Performance wise, the only issues i've had has been while alt-tabbing... nothing new there. Otherwise it's been butter smooth for me.

The controls and feel of the driving?
-The speed feels great and faced paced once you get going and set up the race to use the faster engine types (a bit like mario karts 50cc/100cc/150cc etc).
-The steering for keyboard users, I personally feel the steering aspect still need work, there's something about it i can't put my finger on but when going too fast or too slow, i end up losing my position in the race because i cant turn fast enough to correct a crash when im going slowly, and when im going fast i feel like its too easy to oversteer. A controller of some sorts is definately advised, as with pretty much all racing games. (or maybe i'll try and get my wheel to work...that'll be interesting)
-Rolling in the air to perfect your landing is much harder than the original. it felt really slow to rotate and correct myself and by the time i'd started turning, i'd crashed awkwardly.
But who knows, maybe i just need more practice since i haven't played a rollcage-esque game since 2004-6
-the weapons so far are a trip down memory lanealthough missing some of the originals, but this is early access at the moment and there's more on the way so here's hoping for the time warp, wormhole and ice sheet to come back because they were my favourites:fingerscrossed:.

-The music, while i'm not a fan of the genre, it definitely still suits the game very well so i don't mind listening to it since it isn't bad at all... just not to my taste to want to listen on the daily.

I don't find the price to be too high either. In fact I would've probably paid a little more, since despite it's early access, it's still a great solid arcade racing game, and also because im slightly biased and loved the original.

Oh it also has splitscreen so thats a great bonus. Remember the days when you'd invite a friend over to play games and not just rely on online multiplayer? good times.

Это действительно достойное продолжение серии Rollcage stage, разработчик подошёл с любовью к оригиналу, которой могут позавидовать многие разработчики сиквелов. Реализованы многие режимы, присутствует достаточное количество карт, сложность ботов настраивается и не вызывает проблем. При это разработчик не опускается до копирования. Все треки оригинальны, а некоторые игровые элементы получили новое видение и отличную графическую составляющую. Графика полностью адекватна заявленным требованиям при этом. Каждый новый апдейт регулярно добавляет не только новые машины, вооружения и карты, но и приятные мелочи вроде музыки и погодных эффектов.

Всё же игра пока в раннем доступе и многих вещей не хватает, но разработчик продолжает совершенствовать своё детище. Некоторые трассы порой зубодробительно сложные, придётся действительно осваиваться и исправлять свои ошибки. Если вы фанат подобных гонок - поддержите раннюю разработку рублём, благое дело. Всем остальным рекомендую брать по скидке.

29067244.review:
GRIP, a game that is aiming to return to the unique style of car combat racing games that were Rollcage & Rollcage 2. 

The developers vision is very apparent, they know exactly what they want this game to be, and represent. High octane driving that will literally make your head spin as you try your best to keep control of your car as you fly down the race track at 300mph+.

Winning in this game isn't just about being fast, regardless of what style of race event you are entering. It's about driving on each of the beautifully designed and well crafted tracks intelligently. Using the multiple routes the tracks offer you to your advantage, using the speed boosts effectively, collecting power ups and using them to pummel your opposition into submission all the while avoiding their returning fire. The AI are intelligent and aggressive, requiring you to keep your tactics changing almost instantly on the fly throughout the race. (I can only imagine what racing against real people will be like)

The game also features a stellar soundtrack, it's one of the few games in my library where instead of having my own music blasting in place of the games, I happily turn up the in-game music and enjoy it. 

This game is indeed a very worthy spiritual successor to Rollcage & Rollcage 2. I cannot reccomend it enough to anyone who enjoyed those games, or who enjoy a tough, yet very rewarding combat racing game. Definetly worth the asking price.

29063443.review:
My initial impressions on this one:

- maps/tracks/scenery/vehicles are all artistically (graphics wise), very nice to look at
- track layouts are refreshingly varied & interesting to race on but as of this writing have too many obstacles causing collisions in places and at times when things should be getting fun
- very little content (maybe 2 or 3 good finished tracks to race on and a couple of lower quality work-in-progress tracks)
- no progression, no content to unlock
- mostly poor sound engineering... not exactly a party for your ears until a rocket flies over-head
- a few wonky physics issues still to be worked out
- low budget, understaffed title where progress has proven to be on the slow side
- communicative devloper who often makes himself available right on the Steam forum to answer questions

Overall you can see & feel the potential here...the experience right now in-car can swing back & forth however between exhilarating/fun to confusing/frustrating. Mostly fun, however at this point in time there isn't enough content here to keep you playing.

I'd say even though it's been out now for nearly a year, that this Early Access title is still  a little TOO early and probably should have started it's life as a Kickstarter instead of EA.  You might be best to wait awhile longer to see how things progress over the next 6-12 months. It's definitely worth keeping an eye on.

*It's saving grace is it's currently low price tag...but you'll get what you paid for in this case, IMO.


**EDITED 3 MONTHS AFTER PURCHASE - still no new maps/tracks.

28802713.review:
Stand 29.12.2016 / 10h Spielzeit / ohne Multiplayer:

Das Kritischste vorweg: Dem Spiel fehlt es noch an Content, ja. Das Entwicklerteam werkelt jedoch fleißig an neuen Strecken, Autos, Musik und den sehnlichst erwarteten Multiplayer-Modus.

Nun kurz zum Spiel. Wer Rollcage, Destruction Derby und WipeOut geliebt hat, der wird sich in GRIP auch sehr schnell heimisch fühlen. Es ist brutal schnell und durch die moderne Engine sieht es auch einfach nur verdammt gut aus. Der Spielspaß kam bei mir allerdings erst nach 4-5 Rennen auf, da ich mich erst an die etwas schwierige Steuerung gewöhnen musste – um wirklich auch auf hohem Schwierigkeitsgrad gegen die Bots gewinnen zu können, darf man sich keinen Fehler erlauben und muss die wichtigen Item-Spots erwischen.

Alle Strecken machen sehr viel Spaß und die paar Autos, die es bisher gibt, sehen zwar irgendwie gleich aus, aber das war mir egal. Bei den hohen Geschwindigkeiten hat man für Optik in dem Game eh keine Zeit mehr. Daher finde ich es auch etwas überflüssig, dass man sich Reifen und Felgen auf-pimpen kann. Aber wer's braucht ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Wenn dann endlich mal der Multiplayer-Modus es ins Spiel schafft, dürfte das Spiel noch mal deutlich aufgewertet werden. Bis dahin muss man sich leider an einfachen schnellen Rennen den Spaß suchen, da die anderen Spiele-Modi nicht so langzeitmotivierend sind.

28625769.review:
V podstatě mě závodní hry, či simulátory jakožto milovníka RPG vůbec nezajímají. Rollcage byl výjimkou, kterou jsem hrál hned po vydání v roce 1999 na PC a to jak single, tak hlavně ve split screenu. Tratě jsem znal nazpaměť i v mirror modu a Yuri byl povinností. Včera jsem hledal, zda by se nedal nalézt v nějaké překopané grafice a prožít si tak opět nostalgické chvilky s touto hrou a na co jsem nenarazil. Při pohledu na GRIP mé srdce zaplesalo. Prakticky dokonalý remake Rollcage. S koupí jsem se ani nerozmýšlel a jedna kopie dorazila i na synovo PC, kde mohl utratit něco z Paysafecard darované Santa Ježíškem. 

Mazec. Pocit ze hry je takřka totožný, jako před těmi skoro 17ti lety. Pravda, grafika moc současnému standartu neodpovídá, ale kdo si rád ještě dnes pustí první díl UFA, tomu na nějakém nevyhlazeném pixelu nesejde. Závod samotný je nářezový, adrenalinový masakr. Tak jak to bylo v Rollcage nejlepší. Šílená rychlost, powerupy (miny mi nějak nesedly, zlatý starý trojitý "vrťoch") parádní design tratí (chvilku zase potrvá se je naučit nazpaměť) a nic nedarující protivníci. Zklamáním je trochu zatím chybějící multiplayer a kampaň. Také nějaký postup, jako byl v Rollcage, kde se postupně otevírala cesta k ultimátnímu vozu Yuri.

Hra je, jak už to v dnešní době chodí, v Předběžném přístupu - neboli, cokoli nefunguje se možná časem opraví, zprovozní.  
Což může také znamenat (což také není vyjímkou), že se na hře už nic neudělá. Snad ne a snad se časem zpřístupní alespoň ten mulťák.

Každopádně hru vřele doporučuji, poskytne hodiny a hodiny skvělé zábavy.

28617653.review:
Grip is a throwback to all the old classic 90's/early 00's arcade racing games.
It will immediately remind you of rollcage. Not only does it play like rollcage. But it betters it. 
The developers hearts are well and truly in this one. They wanted to re-create the glory days of future arcade racers. And with each update comes great additions, and improvements. 

The game currently has 7 playable tracks. 16 in total is the aim for completion. 
4 customizable vehicles classes.
A great selection of power-ups.
500mph+ speeds.
A whole host of modes including an old school battle arena.
Online multiplayer is coming soon.
Local co-op works fine.
Beautiful detailed tracks that keep getting things added to them with each update.
A price that is honestly a steal for what you will get.
And a dev team that reads all your comments and replies constantly on the steam forums as well as the grip site forums.

Honestly, grip is the most fun I have had with an arcade racer in years. It's simply 'fun'. And very addictive. And with regular updates that are far from minimal. And a development team with a huge passion for these kinds of games, and communicate daily to their community..............what more could you want from an early access title?

26365299.review:
[b]Provisional Review, Full review once game leaves early access.[/b]
TL:DR - Alright as-is, but will it be ready in time for an end of 2016 release? Also, I wish I could give this a "meh".

Provisional review: I got this game for $15.29 CAD, and I am personally excited for the game to be finished, but as-is, the content is severly lacking, especially less than two months before the targeted "final" release date.
[b]Rant Incoming, mouse over if you care.[/b]
[spoiler]Currently, the game's features, as compared to the aimed goals, are far below the values they hoped to reach in time for the release. There are only 5/16 tracks (not counting the hallowe'en tracks) from 2/4 planets, only two-player local splitscreen (although the beta currently has online multiplayer being playtested), no mod tools, and no career mode! According to the Early Access page, the developers have stated that they expect to finish "the "final" version of GRIP by the end of 2016". Considering that more than half of the game's content is missing just 8 weeks before their deadline, I am worried that developpment may be pushed back into mid-2017. From there, who knows when/if we'll ever see a final version.[/spoiler]
[b]End Rant[/b]

Sorry, I just had to get that off my chest, first. Now, as for the game itself, it revives the long-lost art of "non-Mario Kart" combat racing: The weapons are satisfying to use, although I feel like the missle needs to lock-on and launch faster. The gameplay is fast paced, and the physics are dead-on, but I feel as though the combination of the speed of the cars and the fact that even the smallet barrel can affect the car's path, it leads to a few too many circumstances where the car flies up in the air and off course, in one case costing me the race. This combined with the fact that the controls (not sure if this is just me and my toaster of a PC) feel delayed at times, regardless of keyboard or Gamepad, and it could make races seem unfair at times, especially since the AI can be brutal on the higher speeds and difficulties.  Overall, it just makes me wish that I could pick a maybe for a recommendation. Ultimatley, I have followed this game since it was first founded, and have good faith that the developpers will do whatever they can to make the game better as time goes on.

Still, if you don't have this game in your library yet, hold off for a little bit: Follow this game on steam, and once developpment gets to a point that you feel confident enough to jump in to try the game... wait a little while longer, at least for a sale. This game is slowly, but surely, getting to its final state... but will it meet its end-of-2016 deadline?
26365299.developer_response: Yes, it has taken us a lot longer to complete this game than we had originally planned - but this was largely due to lack of funds which we had reasonably expected to receive. You'll be glad to hear we're very much closer to completion now than we were then, and we guarantee we will be releasing GRIP sometime in 2018. We would urge you to take another look at the game as the difference between now and when you reviewed it is pretty substantial - we'll think you'll find it a lot more compelling than it was back in 2016.

26356000.review: really fun, can't wait for multiplayer

26312170.review:
A very fun, very intense, very fast futuristic racing game which is naturally lacking content due to it's early access.

Gameplay: Racing is very satifying, but can sometimes be frustrating. The game harnesses super high speeds, resulting in very intense, fast moving action. You can find yourself being flung into the sky at points simply because you were going at speeds around 600 KMH, but this is not an issue in the more complete maps. Do not let the speed be a turn off for you however, as I would say its one of the most captivating mechanics of GRIP for good reason. To feel competitive in a race with such tremendous speeds around you, in such a way that your vehicle can drive smoothly up walls, is a feature found few and far in racing games, probably because its hard to utilise as a fun aspect of a race. GRIP executes this well with their tracks being built around many optional roads, shortcuts and large, curved terrain. This gives nice replayability with driving the race tracks, and can put forward different play styles as you go.

Graphics: The graphics in GRIP are probably some of the best graphics I have seen of any racing game, to date. I have Play quite a few racing games over some time, and GRIP has captured almost perfect graphical immersion. From the textures on the car, to the back ground of race tracks, to the beautiful looking transparent shields, GRIP has shown no remorse towards a graphical component. When it comes to immersion, the game will produce a flame like HUD around your screen when you are hitting high speeds as well as a dust effect, having dots splinter your camera. You also see the physical gears of your rough gutted car switch as you gain speed. This game looks beautiful.

Content: Of course, GRIP actually doesnt have a supreme amount of game to play currently as it is in early access. You will find yourself bored and wanting more within 5 hours of play time. As sad of a fact as this is, the developers are not weak with updates, most having content around 1.5 GBs, so you will always have something to toy around with on new updates. However as it stands now, you will run out of things to do quite quickly.

I reccomend it. I encourage that you dont fear a lack of content, as it is dispensed some what consistantly. This game has mega potential, as I am sure you will feel when you try it for the first time.

26272776.review:
Pre-emptive review (will be updated/changed before/on game release):
- its on UE4 , looks great, sounds great. The style and atmosphere is top notch imho.
- the gameplay is ..kinda insane. car combat on 400-700+ km/h (300-400+ mph)+ speeds..
- ride on walls and ceilings, nothing should stop a speed demon.
- very fun if you don't fear death or epilepsy. Feels like Neo Tokyo racing scene at times.
- Great to play sober and not... (I consider it a bonus) Just don't expect to win at that point. 

- different weapon pickups aswell as boost/shield pickups and more. 
- Boost pads on tracks to keep your momentum going if you can handle it.
- different Game modes (more Combat or Speed/final placement focused racing, Arena, Sudden Death etc.), options to choose from (Reverse track!/Mirror Track!/ CatchUp/Laps/Destructible cars etc.)
- selection of planets, each containing varried tracks for racing with alternate paths to take on and master each of them.
- its raw, it will neeed more development time to go and all that... and who knows what will be added/changed.

- It got 4 cars at the moment each with its own character, with color/rims/tires customisation. Naturaly, all of them are insane in their own right, depends on how you like your endorphin delivered.
- multiplayer is in early development/test stage. Split screen available !
- hard to learn, harder to master. 
- begs for a steering wheel/joystick to get the maximum control of your own death...when the speed gets to 600+ km/h
- You can already feel like Yuri Gagarin. We have a Lift Off.

Yes I do recommend this game, I would recommend to have your eye on it (or both), await for it's release or get involved in alpha.
especialy if you like 400-700+ km/h speeds, electronic music, adrenaline, hi-tech/futuristic/sci-fi/ car combat racing on jets with wheels, ..and if you can handle it and want to handle it.

It took me some time to get into it, to learn the handling (the game is still changed/developed so..) but now I do enjoy coming back to it for a few races, to get my junky speed fix.

25929161.review:
What a fun experience!  What an awesomely spectacular game!

It is fast-paced combat racing the way it should be.  Beautifully flowing tracks and intense speed.  At 400+ km/h you're almost a fighter pilot :) ... and you WILL be doing some flying.  Futuristic-looking.  Different planets with different tracks that are gravity-defying and alinear - up becomes down and down becomes up and the tracks split off to form alternative routes.  I totally love the roll-cage thing: you keep going even when the car flips over.  You have a range of weapons to keep your competitors at bay: rockets, guns, shockwaves, mines ...

Even if you're not a big fan of racing games, like me, you might be surprised by this one.  I'd recommend GRIP any day.  For me it's the most fun since that old classic combat racer Re-Volt.  And it's going to keep getting better as development continues.  It most certainly gets my vote.

For a visual reference, watch my GRIP showcase video: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=844398789

Totally bought this out of nostalgia for Rollcage Stage 2, was not disappointed.  I haven't played enough to spot any bugs yet, but I already fell in love with it in the short time I have played.  I'm looking forward to future updates and online multiplayer!

Pros
+Tight racing controls (once you get a feel for it)
+Gorgeous environments
+Sick cars and customizations
+Good amount of content for early access
+Fast paced
+Fun and not too infuriating (Although the AI tends to place mines in the most annoying places)

Cons
-No online multiplayer yet
-Not a lot of cars (theres 3 but the current customization makes up for that at the moment)
-The options are kinda odd, took me a little while to realize X button was drift since it was labelled "Pad Face Left"
-I can only use the mouse to cycle through menus
-Not many power ups
-No tutorial (or at least I havent found one)

If you like combat racers or the old Rollcage games from PS1 days, then you're gonna love this game.

25606197.review:
--- Early Access Review --*

I was just bored, searching the steam store for some new release. There was like nothing interesting, until something caught my eye. "Wait is that new rollcage?" My childhood game where i spent hours playing by myself and with friends. I MUST HAVE IT! - without thinking i bought this 5 minutes after finding it, not knowing almost anything about current playability. I did not regret it.

And here i am, experiencing this amazing racing game greatly inspired by Rollcage series which is more than 15 years old. Racing through apocalyptic world of weaponized cars, which simply cant end up on their roof... kinda... Prepare to be competing in a fast-paced races full of adrenaline, pickups and explosions. Get your weapons ready, its time to put on your racing pants and join the world of GRIP !

NOTE: Following part describes contents of game after september 2017s update. These may no longer be actual as i keep forgetting to update the guide :D

Game Contains:
- 8.. or 9 Playable maps (+mirrored for each and reverse mode for some)
- Multiple (7+) Different Cars
- 1 Arena Mode with 2 maps |Expected: 3 arena modes|
- Carkour Mode with few maps = short obstacle courses
- About 7-8 pickups (weapons & powerups)
- Car customization
- Custom Music Jukebox !

Game Does not contain yet, but will have (almost definitely) in the future:
- Single Player league mode (like in rollcage games)
- Full Gamepad support - you cannot navigate with gamepad in menu yet, gamepad in race works
- Unlockable car customizations
- Some more tracks (race & arena)
- 4 player split screen (currently just 2... read below for more info)
- At least 3 new pickups

What to know before buying:

- Some of actual rollcage devs work on this game !
- Online Multiplayer is available, but not ideal, bugs are being fixed and everything is being improved slowly.
- Split Screen is currently only available with 2 controllers only (Controller + Keyboard doesnt work yet)
Note: You may still play this on your keyboard in single player
- Developers are very open to feedback and suggestion on their official forum site.
- They plan to add few more maps and vehicles, additional gamemodes, some more pick-ups and... possibly workshop and level editor in the later stage? (not confirmed but was talked about)
- Updates about once a month, latest news on their official discord channel (google to find it)


Highly recommending so far :)

25535914.review:
As a guy who grew up playing rollcage, everytime i start the game I have the same feeling than I used to have in the original one. if you loved that game, it is a must buy! if you didn't, well you arrived in the right time to see it getting ressurected.

As this game is EA still, it is no surprise that many many things are buggy, unbalanced or simply just need some polishing, as well as many content to be made for it.

many people write about how things are getting better, car handle, maps, etc, and I don't really feel like repeating them. We just got the ability to recolor our cars as well as many many new small things like new lock-on indicators and ui and stuff like that. 

the game is progressing in a nice pace, the devs seem really dedicated to make the game as good as they can, and it's not a surprise as some of them are the original devs of rollcage, and I'm sure they want to remake is as much as I want a remake.

Overall I can only recomend it if you are a fan of rollcage or other combat racers (eg wipeout, blur, split/secoound etc) and long for something epic with rocket boosters miniguns and neckbreaking tracks and speed. but you have to accept that there are bugs and very little content yet, but its getting bigger with very patch. So if you are into EA stuff go ahead throw a few bucks for the devs, if you are just getting into ccombat racers, or not really keen on EA, then just follow it and watch how it progresses, because it deserves the attention!

25040488.review:
"Combat Racing Is Back"... Да, чёрт возьми! Этим практически всё сказано! 
Гоночная аркада с примесью футуристики и боевика... помните тот фееричный старенький RoolCage? Автомобили перевертыши, которые несутся с безумнейшей скоростью по треку (бездорожье/асфальт/пещеры/тоннели) на всех плоскостях и даже вверх тормашками? При всей происходящей на экране неадекватности и угара еще нужно было собирать бонусы на трассе, которые давали какие-нибудь преимущества (щит, оружие, ускорение, мины), что усиливало напряжение в процессе и без того дичайшей погони... Помните? Я вот помню... 
И временами даже вспоминал и размышлял над тем, почему же никто не догадался воссоздать такую умопомрачительную гоночную аркаду на современных технологиях? Сколько можно клепать одни и те же уличные гонки, ралли, симуляторы... дайте нам экшона и угара, например! 
И вот... GRIP! Воссозданная командой "Caged Element Inc." умело копирует и дарит нам тот самый RollCage, с дичайшими трассами и большеколёсными болидами. 
Да, игра находится в "Раннем доступе" (т.е. игра на данный момент сырая, имеет всего 2 вида болидов, 5 игровых режимов, 8 трасс...), но когда я запускал игру впервые трасс было меньше, как и режимов, также было меньше и "бонусов"... Т.е. игру постоянно обновляют и патчат, тем самым приближая данный проект к настоящему релизу! Это не дохлый забытый проект, чтобы срубить бабла на фанатах олдскульной RollCage! Это действительно с любовью создаваемая игра! Двигло Unreal Engine 4 делает своё дело, картинка просто впечатляющая! 
Всем тем, кто знаком с RollCage - смело рекомендую к покупке, уже сейчас можно зарубиться на разделенном экране, а совсем скоро нам обещают онлайн и новые обновления! 
P.S. Дополнять обзор по релизу игры, наверное, не буду, т.к. мнение о игре, я уверен, останется только крайне позитивным, как и сегодня!

24948613.review:
The asking price may be a bit high for a game thats still in development, but after getting in a solid hour of gameplay and racing multiple tracks several times i can honestly say that i havent played a racing game this fun in a long time.

This game plays somewhat like a Mariocart game or the game Blur for the playstation referring the pickups you get during racing.  There's even a missile with a blue smoke trail that goes for the guy in first reminicent of the blue shell from Mariocart, which is always a good laugh (unless you're in first).  The car choice is very limited with mulitple colorations for the 2 choices, but this isnt really a bad thing.  The tracks are mostly well designed and thought out quite nicely.  The scenery of each track is great to look at too, especailly when you crash into something and come to a dead stop (then you can really enjoy the view!).  

The controls for the game, overall, are very responsive which is great.  However, there are times where, when your car catches air, the vehicle controls about as well as a paper plate with a radio transmitter on it with you telling it through a microphone to turn left or right depending on where the track goes. This can be frustrating mainly due to the fact that you can throw yourself off the track by mistake, ruining the great positioning you achieved.  Now, this isnt game breaking by any means, but its still quite the annoyance when your car bumbs into a rock going 300 mph which sends your car tumbling and skipping along the track every which-way making it all the more difficult to regain control and get your car moving in the right direction again.  But getting a better feel for how the tracks are and how your car handles on them can compensate for this later on.

The A.I. is also good.  They are about as competent as you are on the track and can mess up the same as a normal player would.  If the A.I. becomes too challenging for you, there are adjustments in the game that makes it so the computer wont completely leave you behind, giving you a chance to catch up.

There are a few things still needing improvements on, but the developers are excellent in recognizing potential problems and correcting them.  They are deligent in keeping their game as balanced yet fun as possible.

Overall, if you have 15 bucks to spare and are in the mood for EXTREMELY fast paced racing, i highly recomend this game. 

9/10

WARNING: This review was written when this game was in Early Access. If and/or when the title is fully released, I wll eventually get around to changing my review to reflect that.

I may have played the original Rollcage once in my life, years ago. Whatever the case, I had one of the toys as a child and loved the shit out of it.

I bought grip because it looked fun and I wanted combat racing without mario in it. It's been a lot of fun. The weapons are alright, the car handling is okay, and the wallriding/upside-down driving functionality works great. The missile pathing still needs some work, but the devs have been on that from the getgo, trying to get it right. The physics in the game also need some work, as hitting things can send you flying in directions and ways that don't make much sense. Don't worry too much, as the devs have tweaked the physics in every patch, and are trying very hard to get it right.

Now, is the game worth the price? Eehhh.....maybe. Depends on you really. It is a ton of fun though, and you should play it for a few hours before you really drop it. And if you're having a ton of trouble flying instead of driving, try turning down the engine power in the settings.

I pop back and race this once in a while, and hope to dedicate a bit more time soon. Bit of a fan of the original Rollcage, even if I did find it tricky. This game has a futuristic cool very much like Wipeout, another favourite of mine. If anything this is cooler, with its grungy electro, DnB sountrack.

Since I last played, the control feels tighter, and more responsive. Although you can still easily take off and seemingly spend an age in the air. I think the vehicles could use more weight to bring them down when airborne. Also air control.... Let go of the gas and steer left or right. Ok, and what does that do? I have yet to notice it doing much at all. Once airborne you can pretty much kiss that lap goodbye in a lot of cases.

I do like the fact this game rewards a more careful use of braking and acelerating than some arcade racers, and the handrake will be something I have to decide to use now and again. It is a game that rewards mastery of its precise controls. That being said, they may alienate some people looking for a more instantly pleasing racer. 

So in these early stages it is playable and improving, if not exacty innovating in any way. Maybe that is a gamble they don't want with this first "Grip", but I hope it is popular enough for a sequel which experiments with the weaponry and tracks and adds something new to the mix.. It is fun, and stylish. Maybe it could steal a few moves from Rocket League, in terms of meanouvering in the air with a fip or something. I feel more in control in that game in such a situation. All in all though, I have high hopes for this game, and it brings back fond memories of an era of gaming that has faded somewhat.

24454754.review:
"Roads...? Where were going we don't need 'roads' " 

A great futuristic racer with all of the familiar "tropes" from what made the original inspiring series so awesome.
 
TLDR: Worth Buying! Great graphics, sweet electronic tunes and fluid controls.

Sleek design, a unique mechanic of driving on any surface at high speeds, and the unbridled speed and chaos of launching yourself at high velocity into a wall only to barrel off and continue blazing along down the track. This stays true to its source material by including a great soundtrack with heavy electronic tunes that blast along as you continue down the track. Some cool weapon pickups (I wish the warphole weapon of the original were here still!) and great track design.

If you remember the PS1 era futuristic racer (Rollcage) this has all the original trappings of that great series and more, presented with a stylish visual update. If you're a fan of futuristic racing games or racing games in general it deserves a playthrough especially if you have never experienced the series before. 

As far as future content goes, the tracklist is very limited as of 07/22/16 at  there are only 4 tracks and no League Mode as of yet. It appears the developers intend to include at least league mode. Hopefully some tracks similar to the levels in the original i.e. a downtown metropolis / futuristic city, a coastal area with building struts you can take out to take down buildings, a lava level, etc... Would be great to see! What matters is what content that is presented is very well done. I almost feel I could do without the playground, deathmatch, and elimination modes in favor of a more robust league / cup tournament mode and more levels. 

If you're a fan of the old series Rollcage it's a no-brainer purchase. If you're a fan of racing games otherwise, it's worth experiencing. If you're a fan of electronic tunes and futuristic stuff / cart esque racers with weapon pickups, you'll probably dig it. This is the best futuristic racer available on Steam as of 2016, hands-down. A great addition to a great franchise.

24333701.review:
Grip is a very fast, futuristic combat racing game. With very nice looking graphics and nice soundtrack, the game can be an adrenaline rush. It’s a racing game where you can drive on walls and even the ceiling upside down. This takes racing to another level as you can use the terrain to your advantage. Combine that with weapons and power ups it’s a really nice game. It’s in early access at the moment so you can expect bugs and such.

[h1]Graphics:[/h1]

The graphics looks absolutely gorgeous in this game. It runs on Unreal 4 engine so you can expect some nice graphics. The maps also look very themed, like the snowy track is dark and really feels like you’re racing in the snowy mountains. Plenty of option in the graphics menu as you can expect from any Unreal engine based game. I played the game on high settings (maximum is the EPIC setting.) and I was getting 40-60 FPS throughout.

[h1]Sound:[/h1]

The music in this game is sort of a hybrid between techno and a little bit of metal thrown in. It’s very upbeat and fuels your adrenaline you get from the races. This sort of music is well suitable for a fast paced combat racing game. The good thing about music in this game is that you can individually select the tracks you like and turn the others off. There are a total of 10 tracks as of this review.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]

At the moment you can only play 1 player or 2 player split screen. The split screen can be done horizontally or vertically. There is no campaign or multiplayer mode as of now but the developers are working on it. The car has huge wheels with the body in the middle so the wheels are sticking out on top and bottom, this means if the car even gets flipped upside down, you can keep going.

There are many types of games you can play. Simple race, elimination, deathmatch, playground and time trial. All of these are pretty fun. Simple races are regular races where you have to complete a number of laps and whoever finishes first wins, if you get hit by enemy missiles or gun you will respawn. The Elimination is also like racing except when you eliminate someone they’re permanently out of the race. Deathmatch is a car arena where you have a certain number of combatants and you must go around collecting power-ups and trying to eliminate others. Last one standing wins the match. The playground is also arena with all sorts of tunnels, pipes, half-pipes and other obstacles and there are a certain number of collectibles you must pick up within the allotted time. The time trial is basically you trying to do the track in best time.

You get pickups and you can hold 2 pickups at one time. The first one can be triggered using the shift while the second can be triggered by pressing the control key on the keyboard. These power ups include a machine gun, missiles and mines. There’s also the nitro boost speed power up and another protection power-up which sort of gives you armor at the back of your car so you can defend against machine gun or missiles attacks from behind. 

There’s a total of 2 racing tracks, 2 combat arenas and 1 playground map at the time of this review. The developers are working on more maps and more content. So keep an eye out for future updates which can make this game even better. 

A gameplay video of a race I did can be found below:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=724952100

[b][u]Graphics: 8/10[/u][/b]
[b][u]Sound: 7/10[/u][/b]
[b][u]Gameplay: 8/10[/u][/b]
[b][u]Overall: 7/10[/u][/b]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]

The game has very fast paced adrenaline fueled combat racing.  Arcade type of racing with weapons combat. You can drive on walls, ceilings of tunnels, sides of the mountain basically any terrain. The camera will follow you no matter how many times you flip upside down inside of a tunnel, this makes it a very fun experience in my opinion. The game certainly has bugs and low FPS from what I could tell but it’s in early access, so the developers are ironing out the bugs hopefully.

24300798.review:
[h1]Portable Description[/h1]
GRIP is a battle racing game with a style reminiscent of similar combat racers released near the turn of the century, most notably Rollcage. With beautiful visuals and a heart-pumping soundtrack, GRIP is a fantastic way to release any pent up destructive tendencies. Note: GRIP is still in [b]Early Access[/b]. There is currently no online multiplayer or campaign mode as of yet, but the game is still extremely promising. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
[u][b]Game Modes[/b][/u]
GRIP can be played either solo, or with a local coop buddy. There is currently no multiplayer/campaign [i]yet[/i]. To start a match, you must first choose a game mode, then a planet and track/arena. There are 8 different maps, some are WIP, available for play at the moment with a few tracks that are mode-exclusive. Each game mode can be customized by changing various settings, such as: No. of laps/combatants, difficulty, reversed/mirrored tracks, etc. The included game modes are:

[list]
[*]Races
[*]Elimination
[*]Deathmatch
[*]Playground
[*]Time Trial
[/list]

[u][b]Item Pickups[/b][/u]
Pickup platforms are placed throughout the levels which provide the player with weapons or powerups, such as:

[list]
[*]Raptor: high-impact machine gun.
[*]Scorpion: homing missile that targets the opponent in front of you.
[*]Assassin: tracking missile that targets the current opponent in 1st place.
[*]Quaker: proximity mine.
[*]Aegis: rear-facing shield.
[*]Firestorm: turbo-boost.
[*]EMP: EMP that shuts down opponents' engines. 
[/list]

[u][b]Video Gameplay (15 min)[/b][/u]
https://youtu.be/d5Ht7D3tHtc 
[h1]Controls[/h1]
[u][b]Handling[/b][/u]
GRIP's vehicular handling is not as tight as a kart racer, nor is it as realistic as a racing sim (for obvious reasons). The cars seem to be designed to go airborne, careen out of control or switch perspectives very often as you are essentially controlling an RC flip car. Although the handling is perfectly acceptable if these are the design intentions, controlling the cars are not as fluid as I had hoped. The developers are aware of this and the collision physics are a WIP. A couple suggestions that may help improve handling experience are listed below, however, I understand it may be very difficult to actually incorporate them. 

[list]
[*]Increasing the vehicle’s weight, or sense of one. 
[*]Reducing the reliance of releasing the accelerator to improve control; allow for strict handbrake control at full acceleration.
[/list]

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
[u][b]Art & Sound Design[/b][/u]
GRIP's visuals are truly magnificent. The tracks are extremely varied from each other with regards to level design, aesthetics, and environments. The different biomes you can race or battle through can be extremely luscious, barren or frigid; however, what remains the same is that the graphics are so good that they can sometimes distract you from the main objective. The accompanying EDM and fast-tempo soundtrack also does a fantastic job keeping you focused and immersed while providing a sense of speed and adrenaline rush.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[u][b]Early Access[/b][/u]
For those that are not aware of the Early Access concept, it is perfectly acceptable for bugs to be present (only minor ones observed) and game mechanics to be missing. According to the Early Access notes:

[i]The full version of GRIP will have 12 cars (3 classes), 16 tracks (4 planets), 10 pickups, career mode, arcade mode, arena mode (with arenas), precision mode (with a few tracks), multiplayer (online or local LAN and split-screen), mod tools for custom cars, and (depending on funding moving forward) a track editor so players can build their own courses. Our goal is to have the "final" version of GRIP by the end of 2016, though with the right support GRIP will never be final, as we hope to be adding new cars, tracks and possibly pick-ups well into 2017. [/i]

The developers have shown interest in maintaining GRIP’s balance and development progression as seen in the major monthly patch notes [url=http://steamcommunity.com/games/396900/announcements/]here[/url], and active responses in the Discussions board.

[u][b]Verdict[/b][/u]
GRIP is an extremely promising, albeit limited-content, combat racer/arena battler. With its impressive visuals, level design and combat mechanics, I can easily recommend this game to battle racing/arena fans; however, it is understandable to want to wait until the game releases career/multiplayer modes (local coop is already supported). For those that pick-up the game right now, understand that you have the power to help guide the developers with their balancing tweaks and feedback suggestions. They are very receptive and seem to incorporate player responses fairly well. 

[table][tr][td]Review copy provided by Caged Element Inc.[/td][/tr][/table]

23983906.review:
What is GRIP? to paraphrase the great 21st century singer Lionel Richie:

"oh....what a feeling.....when you're driving on the ceiling"

THE SHORT REVIEW:
If you have fond memories of an old game called Rollcage then you will love this - it's pretty much the same game, by the same developers.

THE LONG REVIEW:
If you've never heard of Rollcage it will be tough to describe just how nuts this game is......
1)   It's frighteningly fast racing
2)   You can drive up walls....and on the ceiling.....
3)   It doesn't matter whether your car flips over, and ends up upside down - it just keeps on driving
4)   You can maneuver it in the air
5)   As if dealing with defying gravity at speeds which will make your eyes bleed wasn't enough - you also have various                weapons to attack other drivers with. And they don't hesitate in using them on you......   

Between the sexy graphics, blistering speed, intense sound effects, pumping electronic musica and general mayhem, it's enough to leave you feeling a bit woozy. 

At this point that's the only downer with GRIP - as much as it's sensory overload for your brain, it's also a little bit more than the camera can keep up with at times. However that can be easily fixed as the game develops. This is otherwise pretty polished for Early Access, though considering they previously developed two Rollcage games that's hardly surprising as this is, well, Rollcage in all but name.

The content is a bit small at the moment, and online play isn't implemented yet, but the early signs are very encouraging. And it's super fun......but sick bags are not included with a purchase of the game. Now, if you'll excuse me - I need to lie down, as the room is spinning......

23628505.review:
[h1]Rollcage is back and its better than ever.[/h1]

As a "veteran" Rollcage player I had some pretty high expectations for GRIP, especially hearing that some original devs were involved. I was not disappointed.

The early access demo was almost like [i]a modern trip back in time[/i], impressive graphics with an amost nostalgic feeling. The level selection was diverse but limited, this can be excused by the fact that GRIP is still in it's early stages. 

The soundtrack is very well-suited to what is happening in game. The fast pace of Modern Drum and Bass and also a fresh taste of Old-school Jungle sounds is enough to keep you glued to your headphones. To think that there are many more tracks to come gets me even more excited to see GRIP grow.

Gameplay-wise GRIP controls like it should. Your cars flip and tumble like crazy and your weapons are more destructive than ever. Sure, the movement of the cars are not as fluent as they were in Rollcage, but they are still as enjoyable as hell!

For a spiritual-successor to Rollcage, GRIP does an incredible job of modernising the franchise for a newer audience. I can't wait to see the game evolve into something even better.

My only complaint is the lack of Ultrawide support (as I'm running a 21:9 monitor), but apart from this, GRIP is well worth supporting.

Any airtime usually ends in disaster, never being able to properly plant the landing without spining around.  Forget any small bumps or dips in a turn, those will spin you.   This is a big deal since it makes you drive self conciously trying purposfully not to steer at all.  SO DISAPPOINTED since the latest patch seems to tout that thie current model is what they are "striving for".. If that's the case, I'm not playing this frustrating game anymore, sorry.

23379350.review:
Three tracks, two classes of car, only singular race modes and I’ve sunk 15 hours into this bad boy. Without a doubt, some of the best fun I’ve had in a racing game in a very long time. You’ll have your head tilting and body leaning into corners with these furious races.

Pros:
Fast & fun gameplay – jump into a race and put the peddle to the metal. Prepare to 'woo'
Killer music – original soundtrack is loads of fun and really suits the vibe of the game
Short game is a good game – great for burst gameplay sessions when you have twenty min to kill
Actual skill is involved – learning when to apply the brakes, deaccelerate and line up your jumps makes you feel like you’re becoming a better racer. Also learning how to cop a hit can save you from spinning out from a missile
Different day, different mode – Multiple modes of play are fun. You have standard races, elimination races, battle arena mode and time trial will keep you occupied
Diverse tracks – all the tracks are very distinct and have their own unique feel. You can also reverse and mirror the tracks too

Cons:
Too easy – at first I struggled to take first position, but now I can snatch the trophy even when giving the AI a lap lead
Physics are inconsistent – much better than what they used to be, but the physics can get annoying when you’re airborne or collide with other racers
Static tracks – at the moment there is only one track which can have its course altered by racers. This feature is promised to be fleshed out, but for now it’s lacking

Points about early access:
Updates occur about once a month, but they usually have substantial content. The physics engine is being worked on, so at the moment the car physics are a bit wonky. But I like to think that adds to the challenge. The developers are very active in the forums and chat to lowly peasants like myself. More tracks, cars, songs and modes to come.

This game is incredible. Get it.

23179459.review:
Grip, a combat racing game inspired by, and pretty much is, a child-hood classic of mine Rollcage. With a cast of some of the previsious developers of the original game, Grip doesn't fall short of taking me back to the days of sitting around my Playstation 1 whilst flipping my 4-wheeled monstrostity up the walls and through the air.

As an arcade-feeling race game, Grip delivers gorgeous graphics using the unreal engine 4 and a variety of colourful and challenging tracks. The vehicles have a gratifying sense of weight to them, yet they are quick and nimble enough to satisfy you speed lovers.

The soundtrack for GRIP is brilliant! With various artists providing their thumping drum & bass/ dance/ electro tracks you can't help but feel the excitement as you race. Not only that, there are more artists to be added as the game develops further.

Overall, GRIP provides and fun and entertaining single-player and more importantly split-screen mode that follows the feel of the previous games. With a small selection of tracks to choose from and varying levels of difficulty and speeds, should you invest in this early release title? The answer, yes! While, at the moment, I would suggest there is enough in the current title to give you value for money. Clearly, this is an unfinished title and it isn’t without it’s minor bugs, but, these are minor such as the odd glitch or game crash here or there. I would expect that these issues are ironed out as the game progresses and I’ll be keeping a close eye on this game, I am impressed and I can’t wait for more.
I really do think this game is going to be huge! The developers keep pushing further updates each month and the game just gets better and better!

[UPDATE] This is still a great game with exciting new features/ improvements with every update. I wish they would bnring back controller support though.

However, there are issues that are in needing of resolution in order for it to become a fully fleshed Rollcage homage. This is understandable due to the fact that it -is- just pre-alpha. Though even at this stage, the game is pretty fun. 

That and the music is sick. It really fits, y'know? 

I'd definitely recommend it.
